info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 01 at 9:40PM PDT until September 02 at 1:30AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Nye County in south central Nevada... Northwestern Clark County in southern Nevada... * Until 130 AM PDT. * At 940 PM PDT, Emergency management officials reported flash flooding on Highway 160 between Pahrump and Mountain Springs Summit from heavy rainfall earlier this evening which produced between 2 and 3 inches of rainfall. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Highway 160 between Pahrump and Mountain Springs Summit, Lower Kyle Canyon Road, Red Rock Canyon, Sandy Valley, Highway 95 between Paiute Way and Lee Canyon Road. Emergency management officials request that motorists do not attempt to travel Highway 160 to Pahrump until further notice due to road damage and debris. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
